item.title: Do you know Java: Underscore as identifier
item.description: We could use underscore as a variable name until Java 7, but it cannot be used as an identifier from Java 9 and upwards. Java has strict rules about how to name a variable, which characters are accepted in it or which one can be the first one. Underscore is a legal character among alphabetic characters and numbers. What if I did not use any other chars just underscore? Is that still valid variable name?
